subject: Insane customs tax after my pedals were re-sent
description_text:
I initially ordered my pedals in November of last year, and they got lost
in the middle of shipping.
Before they got lost, I got asked by simsonn to pay $40 extra for the
shipping and customs declaration. When i got the confirmation that they
were lost, i sent an email to this address and got a reply days later, and
the pedals got re-sent. This time, it worked, and the delivery is expected
for January 22nd. But now, i got an email from DHL that i have to pay $183
for my package to be delivered. This is an insane price, almost as much as
the pedals themselves. This was unexpected, especially considering the
previous payment and re-send.
At this point, i'd rather just get a refund and send the pedals back,
because this price is way too high to be worth it.
I just want to know if i can get any help with it, whether that be a refund
and shipping it back or at least partial coverage of this.

conversations.body_text: Hi Davizinhobeltrao,    We completely understand how you feel. Brazilian customs duties are often outrageous, but there's nothing we can do about it. We will refund the excess shipping charges you paid.
